page.title: 11The Local Natural Habitat
page.content: The trees of our area are mostly deciduous with some evergreens. They are mixed with; oaks, chesnuts and beech. In these trees the many inhabitants include the green woodpecker and the grey squirrel. The green woodpecker, like the grey squirrel likes deciduous trees to build her nest. We have a network of streams of which{Cattley}brook is one . It swirls down through a series of ponds and into the river{Derwent.}It is a very popular place with the watervoles. They come to the brook to catch fish,frogs and newts. Also they will suck up spawn of any kind and will eat any available insects. The trees by the brook are mostly Sycamore, Chesnuts and Oaks which drink water from the moist ground so that they thrive better there.
